definition: original/originally/at first/it goes without saying/of course
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.chinese: 因爲生活本來就是一往直前的。

sentences.english: We don't change things out of personal prejudice.
sentences.chinese: 不要因爲個人成見而改變事物的本來面目。

sentences.english: The court is supposed to be the final arbiter of what is or isn't constitutional.
sentences.chinese: 對於是否合乎憲法，法院本來是最終的裁決者。

sentences.english: I suppose we could have loved her.
sentences.chinese: 我想我們本來也可以愛她。

sentences.english: He would order 300 musicians at a time to play the Yu for him.
sentences.chinese: 有一個南郭先生，本來不會吹竽，也混在中間湊數。

sentences.english: The world itself is colorful and varied, and it is impossible to have one mode.
sentences.chinese: 世界本來就是富厚多彩的，不有可能只有一種模式。

sentences.english: Linda didn't catch the train. She could have caught it.
sentences.chinese: 林達沒能趕上火車，她本來是可以趕上的。

sentences.english: McConnell was a big city bookseller.
sentences.chinese: 他本來是住在城裏的大書商。

sentences.english: He could have asked Lao Wang for help.
sentences.chinese: 你本來可以叫老王幫助你的。

sentences.english: Consider creating scripts to automate the regular maintenance of queue managers.
sentences.chinese: 考慮創建腳本來自動化隊列管理器的定期維護。

sentences.english: I would not have written, but justice requires my character to be defended.
sentences.chinese: 我本來可以不寫，但正義要求我爲自己的品格辯護。

sentences.english: He would put on weight if he ate too much.
sentences.chinese: 他本來是會發胖的，可是他加意節食，起根不會多喫。

sentences.english: We don't want to come down too hard on her.
sentences.chinese: 我們本來不想和她捱得太緊。

sentences.english: I was going to keep my mouth shut but they fucked with the wrong guy this time.
sentences.chinese: 我本來是什麼都不想說的，但是這次他們惹錯了對象。

sentences.english: You are right, I had judged the people the goes only on sunday to Church.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，我本來就只有從人民羣衆的周七教堂。

sentences.english: I didn't want to go out anyhow.
sentences.chinese: 天正下着雨，不過我本來就不想出去。

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
so much/this much/how much?/this way/like this
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
